      <marc:subfield code="a">Reproductions en fac-similé des ébauches manuscrites de Bram Stoker accompagnées de leur transcription, ainsi que ses notes tapuscrites</marc:subfield>

    <marc:datafield tag="378" ind1=" " ind2=" ">
      <marc:subfield code="a">Bram Stoker's initial notes and outlines for his landmark horror novel Dracula were auctioned at Sotheby's in London in 1913 and eventually made their way to the Rosenbach Museum and Library, where they are housed today. This comprehensive work reproduces the handwritten notes both in facsimile and in annotated transcription. It also includes Stoker's typewritten research notes</marc:subfield>

      <marc:subfield code="z">eng</marc:subfield>

Indexation :  miller elizabeth russel bram stoker initial notes and outlines for his landmark horror novel dracula were auctioned at sotheby in london in 1913 and eventually made their way to the rosenbach museum and library where they are housed today this comprehensive work reproduces the handwritten notes both in facsimile and in annotated transcription it also includes stoker typewritten research notes eighteen bisang robert stoker bram reproductions en fac simile des ebauches manuscrites de bram stoker accompagnees de leur transcription ainsi que ses notes tapuscrites
detailed:
Description : Reproductions en fac-similé des ébauches manuscrites de Bram Stoker accompagnées de leur transcription, ainsi que ses notes tapuscrites.
Bram Stoker's initial notes and outlines for his landmark horror novel Dracula were auctioned at Sotheby's in London in 1913 and eventually made their way to the Rosenbach Museum and Library, where they are housed today. This comprehensive work reproduces the handwritten notes both in facsimile and in annotated transcription. It also includes Stoker's typewritten research notes


Date de première publication : 2008
rebonds: Est une œuvre préparatoire pour Stoker, Bram (1847-1912) Dracula
